channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report X-2024101018
item.description:
Report X-2024101018

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-22T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-15
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was found during sort operations at the INDH location. The fiberboard box contained one metal jerrycan packaged in a plastic bag with styrofoam packing peanuts. The bottom chime was damaged causing the release. Shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024101129
item.description:
Report X-2024101129

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-22T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-12
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the INDH location two fiberboard boxes containing UN2800 were discovered. The shipments were packaged in the manufactures box without DG markings or paperwork. They were placed into a steel salvage package and re being held at the location.

item.title: Report X-2024100940
item.description:
Report X-2024100940

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-22T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-10
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Oct 10th 7 pallets wrapped in black shrink wrap were discovered that were suspected of containing tablets and cell phones. There were no DG markings on the outside of the of the pallet. Further inspection found that the pallets did contain tablets and cell phones that contained lithium ion batteries. The shipment is being held pending FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2024100682
item.description:
Report X-2024100682

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-22T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-04
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A specification cargo tank 1,000 gallons or greater containing any hazardous materials that (1) received structural damage to the lading retention system or damage that requires repair to a system int
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 3rd a package was discovered during the PM sort that appeared to be leaking. The package was marked and labeled as UN1210, Printing ink related material solution, 3, III. It appears that the package was dropped at some point causing one of the cans inside the package to rupture. The spill was cleaned up and placed in to a steel salvage drum pending disposition.

item.title: Report X-2024100798
item.description:
Report X-2024100798

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-10
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the INDH location a fiberboard was found with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained one metal jerrycan and the cap was loose causing a release inside of the fiberboard box. The contents were placed a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024100478
item.description:
Report E-2024100478

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-21T12:23:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-04
  • City: ALEXANDRIA
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 4, 2024, one (1) 1.5 gallon jug of Rapicide PA was damaged by a skid and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Indiana Spill Response (ISR) to remediate the impacted site. The crew deployed soda ash to neutralize the released product. The crew then deployed granular absorbents and utilized hand tools to work them in. All Rapicide PA-impacted materials were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED OUT TO OUTBOUND WALL, WHERE THEY NOTICED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS IN THE MIDDLE OF A LARGE PUDDLE. ONCE THE PUDDLE WAS CLEANED UP, THE PACKAGE AND OTHER AFFECTED BOXES WERE TAKEN BACK TO THE CAGE. IT WAS DETERMINED THAT PACKAGE WAS LEAKING DUE TO LARGE CRACK IN THE BOTTOM OF THE CONTAINER

item.title: Report X-2024100712
item.description:
Report X-2024100712

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-16T09:16:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-07
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 10/6/2024 at approximately 2300, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Hub Security in Indianapolis, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of 4 wooden pallets, each supporting a large fiberboard gaylords, containing used cell phones and cell phone batteries. The shipment was discovered by security after collapsing under the weight of the inner contents, revealing the cell phones. The shipments were not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, missing the required markings, labeling, and paperwork. The shipment was held for the FAA investigation.
